data.text: Revitalising Europe means bringing reality of today’s Europe, of its institutions and policies, closer to wishes and concerns of citizens.

Jean-Claude Trichet: At the moment I still have close to 5 months ahead of me and quite a lot of challenges obviously http://t.co/YxBcwaN
Jean-Claude Trichet: All advanced economies have a major new challenge to adjust to an important role of emerging countries
Jean-Claude Trichet: With inflation and successive deprec. of currency or devaluation countries don’t have a winning but a losing strategy
Jean-Claude Trichet: My message would be to all governments, particularly in euro area, that they have to take fiscal policy very seriously
Jean-Claude Trichet: It is extremely unlikely that our democracies would put for a second time 27% of GDP of taxpayers risk on the table
Jean-Claude Trichet: We are saying very clearly that they should avoid compulsion, credit event, or selective default or default

Jean-Claude Trichet: More speed and automaticity in sanctioning mech. in SGP, but also in broader macroecon. policy surveillance framework
Jean-Claude Trichet: EA econ. governance framework devised in 90s has not been implemented and has proved too weak during the crisis
Jean-Claude Trichet: Those who are questioning the viability of EA as single currency area on grounds of econ. heterogeneity are misguided
Jean-Claude Trichet: Dispersion of unit labour costs ahead of and during the crisis very similar in EA and US http://t.co/nGoYHoj
Make sure to also check the charts of the speech of Jean-Claude Trichet  http://t.co/nGoYHoj
Jean-Claude Trichet: Contrary to what is generally perceived, the dispersion of many of the key indicators is similar in US and EA
Jean-Claude Trichet: More than 14 million jobs created since introduction of the euro, compared with 8 million in US http://t.co/CivOPQ8
Jean-Claude Trichet: Real output per capita has grown at a similar pace in the euro area as in the United States http://t.co/CivOPQ8

Constâncio: Arrangements for financial supervision in euro area should be strenghtened by establishment of a pan-euro area resolution fund
Constâncio: Gap between econ. and fin. aspects of euro area governance must be closed by integrating fin. superv. in concept of econ. gov.
Vítor Constâncio: It is crucial that the euro area dimension of economic governance is further reinforced http://bit.ly/iUYbT7
Speech Vítor Constâncio:  The Governance of Financial Stability in the euro area  http://bit.ly/iUYbT7
Jean-Claude Trichet: Therefore, ECB is stressing necessity of strongly reinforcing the euro area econ. governance http://bit.ly/iOAx3E
Jean-Claude Trichet: Econ. gov. framework of euro area not correctly implemented and was too weak during the crisis http://bit.ly/iOAx3E
Jean-Claude Trichet: But governing vast and diverse economies is more challenging in union of sovereign states than in a pol. federation
Jean-Claude Trichet: Those questioning viability of euro area as single currency area on grounds of economic heterogeneity are misguided
Jean-Claude Trichet: Losses and gains in competitiveness in euro area countries similar to those in states of the US http://bit.ly/iOAx3E
Jean-Claude Trichet: Dispersion of ULC before and during crisis was very similar in the euro area and the United States http://bit.ly/iOAx3E
Jean-Claude Trichet: Parallels in euro area and US even in the root causes of dispersion in economic performance http://bit.ly/iOAx3E
Jean-Claude Trichet: Disp. of GDP growth rose a bit during crisis in euro area and US but remained broadly in line with pre-crisis patterns
Jean-Claude Trichet: During crisis we saw temporary increase in infl. dispersion in euro area but this has been reversed over past 12 months

V. Constâncio: Comprehensive programme of growth-enhancing structural reforms is essential to elevate growth potential http://bit.ly/mewG19
V. Constâncio: One approach would be to grant the European Banking Authority more binding powers in euro area countries http://bit.ly/mewG19
Vítor Constâncio: A special regime for financial supervision is warranted for the euro area http://bit.ly/mewG19
V. Constâncio: We need greater automaticity, more ambitious policy requirements and commitments at the EU and national levels
V. Constâncio: We know from crisis, and from learning-by-doing, that soft rules will not achieve the desired outcome http://bit.ly/mewG19
V. Constâncio: Euro area, aside from monetary policy, lacks powerful institutions. Therefore, rule-based frameworks must act a substitute.

L. Bini Smaghi: Respect for contracts is one of key principles of the market economy and the basis of monetary union http://bit.ly/knTDd3
Bini Smaghi: Preventive private sector involvement does not exist elsewhere and would thus make euro area less attractive for investments.
L. Bini Smaghi: Spreads were gradually coming down last autumn, but they spiked up after the Deauville agreement http://bit.ly/knTDd3
L. Bini Smaghi: It would delay any return to the market by a sovereign and would thus discourage private sector involvement.
L. Bini Smaghi: Restructuring would punish patient investors, who are sticking to their investment and it would reward speculators.
L. Bini Smaghi: The problem emerges when debt restructuring becomes a precondition for financial assistance http://bit.ly/knTDd3
L. Bini Smaghi: Imposing haircuts on private investors ultimately damages the taxpayers of both the creditor and debtor country
L. Bini Smaghi: Empirical evidence also shows that private investors are likely to penalise a country which has a history of restructuring.
L. Bini Smaghi: More often than not, restructurings have been disorderly, harmful and fraught with difficulties http://bit.ly/knTDd3
